# Draft:Khorramdin Rebellion

Khurramites
| combatant2        =  Abbasid Caliphate
| commander1        =  Babak Khorramdin  Nozar
| commander2        =  al-Mu'tasim Khaydhar ibn Kawus al-Afshin Muhammad Ibn Hamid al-Tusi
| strength1         = 20,000-300,000 Khurramites
| strength2         = Unknown
| casualties1       = Unknown
| casualties2       = 250,000-1,000,000 Killed
}}
The Khorramdin Rebellion (Persian:جنبش خرمدینان) was a iranian uprising led by Babak Khorramdin against the abbasid caliphate in Azerbaijan (Iran)
In The 816 AD, Babak Khorram led a rebellion against the Abbasids. which lasted until 838 AD. During these Conflicts, Muhammad ibn Hamid al-Tusi was killed, and an estimated 250,000 to 1,000,000 muslims from Abbasids were killed at the hands of the Khorramids, but in the end, Babak Khorramdin was betrayed, and after that executed by the Abbasid Caliph
Death of Babak
When Babak surrendered, he stood in front of the Abbasid Caliph and humiliates him to the point that the Caliph became angry and ordered Babak's hand to be cut off. After his hand was cut off, he smeared his own hand with blood and rubbed it on his face.When the Caliph asks him why he is doing this, he says: "When the blood comes out of my body, my face will turn yellow and you will think that I am scared, So I hide my face's color.." The Caliph, amazed by Babak's courage, finally orders Babak to be executed.
